casebody.data:
Leroy L. VENNELL, Adm’r, etc., Estate of Paul B. Adamson, Deceased, Appellant, v. UNITED STATES of America. No. 7747. Circuit Court of Appeals, Third Circuit. Argued Oct. 10, 1941. Decided Oct. 13, 1941. Lewis H. VanDusen, Jr., of Philadelphia, Pa. (Drinker, Biddle & Reath, of Philadelphia, Pa., on the brief), for appellant. Carl J. Marold, Sp. Asst, to the Atty. Gen. (Samuel O. Clark, Jr., Asst. Atty. Gen., and J. Louis Monarch and Frederic G. Rita, Sp. 'Assts. to Atty; Gen., and Gerald A. Gleeson, U. S. Atty,, and Thomas J. Curtin, Asst. U. S. Atty., both of Philadelphia, Pa., on the brief), for appellee.

Before MARIS, JONES, and GOODRICH, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

The judgment of the district court is affirmed upon the opinions of Judge Bard, 36 F.Supp. 646 and 38 F.Supp. 381.
